verse: [Therefore,] Since God in his mercy gave us this ·work to do [ministry], we don’t ·give up [lose heart; become discouraged].

But we have ·turned away from [rejected; renounced] ·secret [underhanded] and shameful ways. We ·use no trickery [do not walk in deception], and we do not ·change [distort] the ·teaching [word] of God. We ·teach the truth plainly [fully/openly disclose the truth], ·showing everyone who we are so that they can know in their hearts what kind of people we are [commending ourselves to every person’s conscience] in God’s sight.
If the ·Good News [Gospel] that we preach is ·hidden [veiled], it is ·hidden [veiled] only to those who are ·lost [perishing].

The ·devil who rules this world [god of this age] has blinded the minds of ·those who do not believe [unbelievers]. […so that] They cannot see the light of the Good News—the Good News ·about [that reveals] the glory of Christ, who is ·exactly like [the image of] God.
[For] We do not preach about ourselves, but we preach that Jesus Christ is Lord and that we are your ·servants [slaves; bondservants] for Jesus.

[For; Because] God who said, “Let the light shine out of the darkness [Gen. 1:3; Is. 9:2],” is the same God who made his light shine in our hearts ·by letting us know [or to give us the knowledge of] the glory of God that is in the face of Christ.
[But] We have this treasure ·from God, but we are like clay jars that hold the treasure [in clay jars]. This shows that the ·great [extraordinary; transcendent] power is from God, not from us.

We are ·persecuted [pursued], but ·God does not leave us [not abandoned/left behind]. We are ·hurt [struck down; knocked over] sometimes, but we are not destroyed.

We always carry the death of Jesus in our own bodies [Paul was in constant danger of the kind of violent death Jesus experienced] so that the life of Jesus [resurrection life] can also be ·seen [revealed; manifested] in our bodies.
[For] We are alive, but for Jesus we are always ·in danger of [being handed over to] death so that the life of Jesus can be ·seen [revealed; manifested] in our ·bodies that die [mortal flesh].

It is written in the Scriptures, “I believed, so I spoke [Ps. 116:10].” ·Our faith is like this, too [Having the same spirit of faith,…]. We also believe, and so we speak.
We know that ·God [the one] who raised the Lord Jesus from the dead will also raise us with Jesus and will ·bring us together with you into his presence [present (us) with you].
All these things are for ·you [your benefit], so that the grace of God that is ·being given [expanding; increasing] to more and more people will bring increasing thanks to God for his glory.

So we do not ·give up [despair; lose heart]. Though our ·physical body [outer person] is ·becoming older and weaker [decaying; being destroyed], our ·spirit inside us [inner (person)] is ·made new [being renewed] every day.

·We have small troubles for a while now, but they [For our brief and insignificant trials/tribulations] are ·helping us gain [or producing in us] an eternal ·glory [burden/weight of glory] that ·is much greater than [overwhelmingly exceeds] the troubles.

We set our eyes not on what we see but on what we cannot see. [For; Because] What we see ·will last only a short time [is temporary/transitory], but what we cannot see ·will last forever [is eternal].
